title: Sonoma Port Works 2012 Petite Sirah (Clarksburg)
description: Large doses of smoky oak and sweet spices light up this powerful full-bodied dessert wine, which is very sweet and has an almost thick, viscous texture that coats the mouth.

title: Ste. Chapelle 2015 Panoramic Idaho Malbec
description: Aromas of plum, vanilla, black pepper and barrel spice lead to light citrus and cherry flavors. It provides intrigue but is not entirely successful.

title: Vintage Cowboy 2015 Manchego's Fate Red (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Densely packed rose petals, red currant and boysenberry syrup and a hint of sagebrush make for a fruity and ripe nose on this blend of 60% Merlot, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon and 20% Zinfandel. Tart dusty wild red fruits meet with pepper and lavender on the palate, which is a little disjointed.

title: Washington Hills 2015 Late Harvest Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of lime leaf, honeysuckle, apple and peach are followed by sweet stone-fruit flavors. It goes down easy.

title: Charles Krug 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This Cabernet Sauvignon is bolstered by small portions of Petit Verdot and Merlot. Graham cracker, plum and dark cherry characterize the full-bodied, ripe flavors that ride along a smooth approachable texture.

title: Château Perron 2012  Lalande de Pomerol
description: This wine is now definitely mature. The fruit has been changed into secondary characteristics, with leather aromas and mushroom and spice flavors. Sadly, the tannins are still there, suggesting the wine is drying out. Drink immediately.

title: Ca' Momi 2015 Rosso Red (California)
description: A strong charred-oak element dominates but doesn't overwhelm this medium-bodied and firmly textured wine. It has smoky beefy black-pepper notes over some mild blackberry flavors.

title: Antis 2016 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Fairly dark, roasted berry aromas are more subdued than over the top. This Malbec has energy on the palate, while saucy flavors of plum and berry are just ripe enough. A wiry finish is raw in feel but gets the job done.

title: Big Vine 2013 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is a tad disjointed and hard to define, lacking in structure but big on vanilla bean and baked-apple flavor, with a hint of honeysuckle on the nose.

title: Basel Cellars 2015 Estate Double River Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Not entirely harmonious aromas of smoke, herb, vanilla and crayon lead to smoky blue fruit and barrel flavors.

title: Cave des Producteurs de Vouvray 2015 Les Dîmes  (Vouvray)
description: Named after a parcel of land that has belonged to the village since the Middle Ages, this wine is off dry. Its tangy, lemon and honey character is filled out with peach and almond-paste flavors. The wine is young, needing a few more months to round out. Drink from late 2018.

title: Cerulean 2013 Reserve Acadia Vineyards Tempranillo (Columbia Gorge (WA))
description: Lighter in color with an orange tinge at the rim, the aromas bring notes of leather strap, cherry, cigar box and spice. The flavors are light but juicy. The concentration doesn't seem all there.

title: François Lurton 2017 Piedra Negra Alta Coleccion Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Dark, charred aromas of burnt wood, shoe polish and inky black fruits set up a wiry, chewy palate that's more rough than lush and easy. Clear and present flavors of burnt wood and clove are more prominent than berry fruit, while this is breaks up on a tannic finish.

title: Hanna 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: Aged on lees in stainless steel, this wine presents as reduced and somewhat closed, with a green bean and jalapeño component that distracts.

title: Havens 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Barbecue smoke and sweet baked plum combine somewhat disjointedly in this simple take on the variety, which finishes in a strong taste of tobacco.

title: Monsieur de Bordeaux 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This wine is soft and lightly fruity, with attractive acidity. With its caramel flavor and ripe strawberries, the wine offers a gentle style of rounded rosé. Drink now.

title: Mt. Konocti Winery 2015 Rogers Vineyard Zinfandel (Lake County)
description: Very ripe and fruity, and quite sweet, this full-bodied wine oozes blueberry and blackberry jam, and feels soft and luscious. The sugar element is high enough to relegate this wine to dessert.

title: Oak Grove 2015 Family Reserve Winemaker's Red (California)
description: Very fruity and moderately sweet, this medium-bodied wine has a smooth texture and a generous array of crushed raspberry, strawberry and blackberry flavors.

title: Sobon Estate 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Amador County)
description: Heavy oak aromas and flavors drench this wine with wood smoke, camphor and clove for an extreme personality that will divide consumers. It's medium to full-bodied, moderately tannic and finishes with a sweet sensation from all that wood.

title: Villa Maria 2016 Private Bin Rosé (Hawke's Bay)
description: This is a slightly soapy sipper smelling of candied apples and strawberry hard candies. The palate could use a little more acidity to freshen up the confected fruit but this simple style will nevertheless appeal to many.

title: Bodegas Paniza 2016 Viura-Chardonnay (Cariñena)
description: There's almost no color to this blend of Viura and Chardonnay, nor does it smell like much. On the palate, it is plump but lacking in acidic kick. Creamy flavors of banana and melon turn slightly bitter on the finish.

title: Château Tour de Goupin 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Intensely fruity, this wine is crisp, herbal Sauvignon Blanc, with a light tropical edge that comes from the ripe vintage. It is ready to drink for its fruitiness but will be better after a few more months aging, so wait until the end of 2018.

title: Apex 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)
description: The aromas are light, with notes of herb and citrus while the flavors seem dilute. It doesn't all come together by the finish.

title: Château Vieux Cassan 2015  Médoc
description: Soft and fruity, this is a light wine with gentle tannins and acidity. Black-currant fruits go with the crisp texture to make a wine that will be ready to drink from 2019.

title: CK Mondavi 2014 Scarlet Five Red (California)
description: One of the sweeter red blends, this wine is made from the five red grape varieties traditional in Bordeaux and has nice grapey aromas and juicy fresh blackberry and raspberry flavors. Best to serve it lightly chilled.

title: Domaine de la Motte 2016 Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)
description: This is quite concentrated and herbal upfront, with pronounced minty and spicy licorice tones that sit atop the core of ripe blackberry, plum and cherry. It's a touch angular, with surprising grip to the medium-weight palate, and a mocha-tinged finish. Drink now.

title: Cave Robert & Marcel NV La Petite Marquise Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)
description: This wine is soft, lightly nutty and lit up by bright acidity. Apples and creamed pears have a tangy, mineral edge. Drink this wine now.

title: Celene NV Perlance Brut  (Crémant de Bordeaux)
description: A blend of Colombard and Sauvignon Blanc gives this herbal wine with an attractive perfumed character. It's crisp and fruity, with a bubbly mousse and bright acidity at the end. Drink now.

title: Château de Jad 2015  Bordeaux
description: This estate, in the center of the Entre-deux-Mers region, has produced a successful wine in this warm vintage. The 100% Merlot delivers great fruit while allowing a place for dry tannins. The wine has a lightness to it and is ready to drink.

title: Château Haut Roudier 2016  Bordeaux
description: This wine is all stalky fruit, with young tannins and tight acidity. It is not a wine for aging, with a light texture and spicy structure. Drink from late 2018.
